intro: Parietaria pensylvanica var. floridana, commonly known as Florida wall-rocket, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants commonly known as nettles. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
